bioghist.p: Philip Rieff (1922-2006) was an influential American sociologist, author and cultural critic. He published three books on Freud and culture, including Freud: The Mind of the Moralist. He taught at Brandeis University, the University of California at Berkeley, Harvard University, and the University of Munich, and from 1961 until his retirement in 1992 held the position of Benjamin Franklin Professor of Sociology and University Professor at the University of Pennsylvania. He was married to Susan Sontag from 1950-1959, and their son, David, is a journalist and foreign policy analyst.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes incoming and some outgoing correspondence with colleagues, students, publishers, and others. Significant correspondents include Samuel Carr, Lawrence Gowing, Hamid Dabashi, Mara Dworsky, Samuel C. Heilman, Gordon Marino, John A. O'Connor, and Evelyn Joll. There is also material relating to Rieff's involvement with the Philadelphia Museum of Art.
